channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2024020023
item.description:
Report X-2024020023

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: BULK TENDER NOTICED PACKAGE WAS LEAKING ON THE BELT. NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR AND THEN SUPERVIOR CALLED FOR A RESPONDER TO SHOW UP. RESPONDER SHOWED UP WITH EQUIPMENT NEEDED AND SAFETY MATERIALS ON. CLEANED UP WITH NO PROBLEMS AND NO ONE WAS INJURED.

item.title: Report X-2024020024
item.description:
Report X-2024020024

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: BEDFORD PARK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ARRIVED AT THE SCENE OF THE SPILL WITH MY SPILL CART AND PPE DONNED. NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE IN QUESTION HAD POWDER COMING OUT OF THE CORNERS OF THE BOX. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND FOLLOWED THE RIGHT PATH TO TAKE TO PROPERLY CLEAN UP THE SPILL. AFTER THE CALL WAS MADE BY SUPERVISOR AND CHAIN OF COMMAND WAS ACTIVATED, RESPONDER WAS INSTRUCTED TO AND GIVEN THE GO AHEAD TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. ONCE RESPONDER SECURED THE AREA AND TAKEN CARE OF, PUT THE PACKAGE AND ITS CONTENTS IN A SPILL TRAY AND MADE MY WAY BACK TO THE DMP.

item.title: Report E-2024020016
item.description:
Report E-2024020016

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: CICERO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Pitt Ohio Express
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Upon arrival back at the origin terminal, the drum was discovered leaking on the skid. The drum was placed into an overpack container to prevent further release of material. The released material was neutralized with neutralizing powder. Investigation revealed that the drum was punctured by a protruding nail head in the wooden skid slat. Due to the hazard of material, the packaging specifications could not be safely obtained.

item.title: Report E-2024020024
item.description:
Report E-2024020024

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: UNION
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 26, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN3266 was crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel neutralized the corrosive impacted trailer using a water and citric acid solution. After the dock trailer floor was neutralized, crews deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The 55-gallon drum was overpacked into one 95-gallon poly drum. All waste was then driven to the R+L terminal in Elgin, IL to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024010533
item.description:
Report E-2024010533

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: S CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a leaking 55DM as a result of a forklift accident. Approximately 1-Gallon of UN1993 released onto the dock floor. The customer confirmed the proper PPE to clean-up the release and possession of an 85DM to overpack. XPO successfully overpacked the punctured 55DM into an 85DM for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2024010483
item.description:
Report E-2024010483

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 23, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3475 was punctured during loading and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews observed the released material evaporated prior to their arrival. HCE personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum of product into one (1) 95-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024010830
item.description:
Report X-2024010830

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: MARION
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded on its side allowing it to leak out onto other packages. Upon discovery package was bagged and put in a haz tote, the area affected was cleaned, and the other packages were gathered up to assess damage. DescribePack: Package was loaded on its side. Lid worked loose enough to leak liquid out of outer box and onto other packages. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was quickly bagged and put in a haz tote.

item.title: Report X-2024010628
item.description:
Report X-2024010628

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package containing 4 plastic bottles of dehydrant. The box was stained on the bottom from one bottle that was spilling liquid due to a puncture near the bottom. Stained other bottles but are undamaged. Not safe to transport. Hazmat was in pallet that was shrink wrapped, unsure how it was damaged exactly. Possibly damaged at shipper before it was sent out. DescribePack: Box was wet on the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a hazmat bag inside a plastic bin.

item.title: Report X-2024010650
item.description:
Report X-2024010650

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-31
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Discovery of package was around 7AM, while unloading from trailer# 829871 in the bottom of the belly near the front area. Package outer top area was wet with inner leakage. It was quickly taken out and verified no other package was damaged or soiled by spilled contents. DescribePack: Bottles had loose caps on and with the slightest touch opened easily. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Moved and placed in a hazmat spill bag.
